meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt for a particular purpose or situation.
meanings.sent1: She was tunning the radio to find her favorite station.
meanings.sent2: He spent hours tunning his speech for the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The chef was tunning the recipe to make it spicier.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic was tunning the engine to improve its performance.
meanings.sent5: Tunning the settings on the camera made the photos look much better.

meanings.definition: The act of making something more effective or efficient.
meanings.sent1: Regular maintenance is essential for the tunning of the machinery.
meanings.sent2: The tunning of the process led to significant cost savings.
meanings.sent3: The tunning of the schedule made everyone finish work early.
meanings.sent4: The tunning of the system resulted in faster processing times.
meanings.sent5: The tunning of the algorithm improved the accuracy of the results.

meanings.definition: The process of fine-tuning or adjusting a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The musician spent hours tunning his guitar before the concert.
meanings.sent2: Tunning the piano is crucial for a beautiful sound.
meanings.sent3: The tunning of the violin made it sound like a different instrument.
meanings.sent4: The tunning of the drums created a perfect rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The tunning of the trumpet made it sound clear and bright.
